content: Open QA. Historical information. Provide a concise description.
Tell me briefly (in 4-5 sentences max) what Brexit was

chosen: Brexit was a referendum held in the United Kingdom on June 23, 2016, to decide whether the country should leave the European Union (EU). The result was a majority vote in favor of leaving the EU, with 51.9% of voters voting to leave and 48.1% voting to remain. The referendum was seen as a major blow to the EU, which had been founded on the principle of free movement of people, goods, and services between its member states.
rejected: Brexit was a referendum held in the United Kingdom on June 23, 2016, where voters were asked to decide whether the country should leave the European Union (EU). The result was a majority vote in favor of leaving the EU, which led to the UK's withdrawal from the EU on January 31, 2020. The referendum was seen as a major blow to the EU and its principles of free movement and cooperation among member states. The impact of Brexit is still being felt today, with ongoing negotiations between the UK and EU over their future relationship.
